      public final Random backupRandom

  • Constructor Details

    • RNGSession

      RNGSession​(com.google.gson.JsonObject startRunToken)
      Creates new RNGSession from the provided JsonObject, which should have been retrieved from the Verification-Server. The random Long property of the JsonObject will be used to initialize the currentRNGHandler and backupRandom. The order of Random.nextLong() calls should not be tampered with as to not disrupt any Verification Tools.
      Parameters:
      startRunToken - A JsonObject containing a runId Long property and a random Long property.
      See Also:
      RNGHandler(long)

    • RNGSession

      public RNGSession​(long runId)
      Creates new RNGSession. Should only be used to reenter a previous Session with the runId that session saved. Leaves the currentRNGHandler to be initialized async via the rngHandlerCompletableFuture It is assumed that there will not be an immediate RNGHandler.getRngValue(RNGHandler.RNGTypes) call because the world is being loaded.
      Parameters:
      runId - the Long that will be used as

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static RNGSession getInstance()
      Returns the current RNGSession
      Returns:
      instance

    • getRngContext

      public static Optional<Supplier<Long>> getRngContext​(RNGHandler.RNGTypes type)

    • startRNGSession

      public static void startRNGSession()
      Starts a new RNGSession. If a new RNGSession has already been created async via the rngSessionCompletableFuture it will be retrieved via the CompletableFuture.get() method. In case of a failure, a new RNGSession will be created synchronously which could lead to noticeable lag.

    • stopRNGSession

      public static void stopRNGSession()
      Stops and leaves the instance

    • inSession

      public static boolean inSession()
      Returns whether ServerSideRNG is in a session
      Returns:
      true if the instance and the currentRNGHandler aren't null
      See Also:
      updateRNGHandler()

    • createRNGSessionOrNull

      public static RNGSession createRNGSessionOrNull()
      Creates a new RNGSession using the StartRun token obtained from the Verification-Server. This method should be called asynchronous due to the delay associated with the request.
      Returns:
      a new RNGSession or null if an IOException occurred when making the request
      See Also:
      RNGSession(JsonObject), ServerSideRNG.getStartRunToken()

    • getCurrentRNGHandler

      public RNGHandler getCurrentRNGHandler()
      Gets the current RNGHandler after trying updating it
      Returns:
      the current RNGHandler after calling the updateRNGHandler() method on it.
      See Also:
      updateRNGHandler()

    • updateRNGHandler

      public void updateRNGHandler()
      Updates the currentRNGHandler if it's either out of normal time and the rngHandlerCompletableFuture has completed or it's out of extra time().
      See Also:
      RNGHandler.outOfNormalTime(), RNGHandler.outOfExtraTime()

    • setPaused

      boolean updateSessionState()

    • getRngHandlerFromFuture

      public void getRngHandlerFromFuture()
      Tries to update the currentRNGHandler with the RNGHandler created by the rngHandlerCompletableFuture and then activates it.

      If the CompletableFuture hasn't completed or doesn't complete after one second, the currentRNGHandler will be updated using a RNGHandler created with the backupRandom.

      See Also:
      RNGHandler.activate()
